title: AnneBaked Salmon with Mustard Dill SauceTara | Treble in the KitchenRoadrunnerHeather @ Polyglot JotDanielleAnne10 Immunity Boosting Foods for Cold & Flu Season
directions: Combine all of the marinade ingredients in a baking dish and mix well. Add the salmon, turning to coat evenly. Cover and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes, or up to 6 hours.
Combine all of the sauce ingredients in a small bowl and mix well. Cover and refrigerate.
Place salmon (skin side down) in a foil-lined baking dish with sides. Bake 10 to 15 minutes, or until cooked through.
Top cooked salmon with sauce and salt and pepper to taste; serve with brown rice and the vegetable of your choice.
ingredients: 4 salmon fillets, patted dry with paper towels
¼ cup plain whole milk yogurt
